smell_analysis.justification: All provided diagrams contain model elements; no empty diagrams were found.
In the Use Case diagram (Page 2), all use cases (including 'Tuvasta kasutaja') are connected to at least one actor.
No duplicate use case names associated with the same actor were found in the use case diagram.
No packages were found containing multiple elements with the same name.

Redundant data storage without Foreign Keys was not detected. Common columns like 'nimetus' or 'reg_aeg' appear in multiple tables but represent distinct attributes for those specific entities, or are linked via Foreign Keys where appropriate (e.g., code columns).
All use cases follow a consistent naming convention, starting with a verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Lõpeta', 'Registreeri').
In the State Diagram (Page 11), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, etc.) are reachable from the start state 'Alg' via the defined transitions.
In the Activity Diagrams (Page 3 and 4), all actions appear to be reachable through the decision flows.
All class and database relationships in the diagrams (e.g., Pages 5, 10, 17) show multiplicity indicators (e.g., 1, 0..*, 0..1) at both ends where applicable.
The Use Case diagram 'Teenuste funktsionaalne allsüsteem' (Page 2) contains 11 use cases (central elements), which exceeds the threshold of 10.
No single class or table was found with 6 or more visual connection lines on a single diagram page. The maximum observed was 5 (e.g., class 'Teenus' on Page 10 and table 'Teenus' on Page 17).
The layout of the diagrams is reasonably compact, and no related elements were found with a distance significantly greater than twice the average.
All use case names and activity actions start with an active verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
No class, table, attribute, or use case names were found with 3 or fewer characters. Shortest names found were 'Isik' and 'Riik' (4 characters).
All class names start with an uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Teenus', 'Töötaja').
All attribute/column names start with a lowercase letter (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'nimetus', 'on_aktiivne').
No inappropriate prefixes (Hungarian notation) were found in class, table, or attribute names. Technical prefixes like 'PK_', 'FK_' found in the transformed diagrams are allowed exceptions.
